intro: Anabasis articulata var. ascendens, commonly known as the ascending jointed goatweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features slender, jointed stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
